intro: Disperis ciliata, commonly known as the silky disperis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, with intricate patterns that attract specific pollinators. Disperis ciliata is often found in open grasslands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
